name: DateTimeFieldRoot
description:
Groups all parts of the date-time field.
Renders a `<div>` element and a hidden `<input>` beside.

name.description: Identifies the field when a form is submitted.

defaultValue.description:
The uncontrolled value that should be initially selected.
To render a controlled temporal field, use the `value` prop instead.

value.description:
The controlled value that should be selected.
To render an uncontrolled temporal field, use the `defaultValue` prop instead.

onValueChange.description:
Event handler called when the selected value changes.
Provides the new value as an argument.
Has `getValidationError()` in the `eventDetails` to retrieve the validation error associated to the new value.
onValueChange.detailedType:
| ((
    value: TemporalValue,
    eventDetails: TemporalFieldValueChangeEventDetails,
  ) => void)
| undefined

actionsRef.description:
A ref to imperative actions.
- `clear`: Clears the field value.

ampm.description:
Whether to use 12-hour format with AM/PM or 24-hour format.
Is ignored if a custom format is provided.

placeholderGetters.description:
Methods to generate the placeholders for each section type.
Used when the field is empty or when a section is empty.
If a section type is not specified, a default placeholder will be used.

referenceDate.default: 'The closest valid date using the validation props.'
referenceDate.description: The date used to generate the new value when both `value` and `defaultValue` are empty.

timezone.default: 'The timezone of the "value" or "defaultValue" prop if defined, "default" otherwise.'
timezone.description:
Choose which timezone to use for the value.
Example: "default", "system", "UTC", "America/New_York".
If you pass values from other timezones to some props, they will be converted to this timezone before being used.

step.description:
The step increment for the most granular section of the field.
For example, with format 'HH:mm' and step=5, pressing ArrowUp on the minutes section
will increment by 5 (e.g., 10 -> 15 -> 20).

format.description: Format of the date when rendered in the field.

disabled.description: Whether the component should ignore user interaction.

readOnly.description: Whether the user should be unable to select a date in the field.

required.description: Whether the user must enter a value before submitting a form.

inputRef.description: A ref to access the hidden input element.

children.description:
The children of the component.
If a function is provided, it will be called with each section as its parameter.

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.

style.detailedType:
| React.CSSProperties
| ((
    state: DateTimeField.Root.State,
  ) => CSSProperties | undefined)
| undefined

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.detailedType:
| ReactElement
| ((
    props: HTMLProps,
    state: DateTimeField.Root.State,
  ) => ReactElement)

data-disabled.description: Present when the date-time field is disabled.

data-readonly.description: Present when the date-time field is readonly.

data-required.description: Present when the date-time field is required.

data-valid.description: Present when the date-time field is in valid state (when wrapped in Field.Root).

data-invalid.description: Present when the date-time field is in invalid state (when wrapped in Field.Root).

data-dirty.description: Present when the date-time field's value has changed (when wrapped in Field.Root).

data-touched.description: Present when the date-time field has been touched (when wrapped in Field.Root).

data-filled.description: Present when the date-time field is filled (when wrapped in Field.Root).

data-focused.description: Present when the date-time field is focused (when wrapped in Field.Root).
